pr_title: Detect GC leaks of scopes in StrictContextStorage.

timeline.message: Detect GC leaks of scopes in StrictContextStorage.

timeline.bodyText:
This will leave data in the map as we never touch it again. Since things are weak we won't hold to span structures but we will keep the weak refs around until JVM shutdown.
This was a one reason I went with the NoopMap to avoid the issue to figure out where to place the closed checked :)
probably best to just put it in the existing if statement as the first check.
timeline.author: sfriberg

timeline.bodyText: I ask you... Is "expunction" a word? really?
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: why not have this done in the StrictScope constructor, so it controls the full lifecycle, rather having it put in here, but removed internal to the StrictScope.close()?
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: so, we're only throwing the first that we run across, rather than alert about all the possibilities?
